definitions.definition: a person who performs on the stage, on television or in films, especially as a profession

examples.text: Both **lead actors** *(= the ones who play the main parts)* are outstanding.
She is one of the country’s leading actors.
The movie **starred** a bunch of relatively unknown young **actors**.

definitions.definition: a person who plays a part, pretending by their behaviour to be a particular kind of person

examples.text: I don't know if he really meant the things he said—he was always a good actor.

definitions.definition: a participant in an action or process

examples.text: Employers are key actors within industrial relations.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (originally denoting an agent or administrator): from Latin, ‘doer, actor’, from agere ‘do, act’. The theatre sense dates from the 16th cent.
